intro: Stenostomum radiatum subsp. haitiensis, commonly known as the Haitian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Haiti. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
